fields.host_plant: Bhendi, cotton, tomato, brinjal, castor, cucurbits, tea, citrus, grapes, rose, jasmine, marigold.
fields.lifecycle: Life cycle is completed in 15-20 days
fields.bionomics: About 200 whitish, spherical eggs laid on the ventral surface of the leaves and measure about 0.1 mm in diameter. Egg period 4-7 days, larval and pupal periods 3-5 and 8-12 days respectively.
fields.shape: ovate
fields.growth_rate: there are 15 generations / year.
fields.damage: 1.Nymphs and adults feed on ventral leaf surface, under protective cover of fine silken webs .2. Initially, spider mite damage will appear as small yellow or brown spots on the leaves of the plant. If the plant is badly infested, the plant's health will suffer, it may develop completely yellow leaves and it may stop growing
fields.symptoms: As a result of their feeding numerous yellow spots appear on dorsal side of leaves.Affected leaves gradually start curling, finally wrinkled and crumpled.
fields.natural_enemies: Persimilis is the main predator of spider mites , ladybugs, lacewing
fields.colour: reddish brown.
fields.species: Spider mites are members of the Acari family Tetranychidae, which includes about 1,200 species
fields.species_example: white mite , red spider mite
fields.favourable_condition: In cool climates, they spend the winter resting in soil, while in warmer regions, they live and feed year round
fields.peak_occurance: Most active in dry, hot conditions
fields.reproduction: Parthenogenesis is common. Fertilized female lays 61 to 93 eggs and unfertilized female 39 to 59 eggs. Eggs are laid at random on the webbing on the lower surface of leaves. They hatch in 3 - 27 days for males and females respectively in various seasons. Gravid females are seen during December to March.
fields.preventive_measures: Prefer Spinx and temptation varieties as they are moderately susceptible Avoid First Red as it is highly susceptible. Remove and destroy the damaged leaves along with mites.
fields.insectiside: Spray wettable sulphur 50 WP 1.0 kg (or) dicofol 1.0 L or abamectin 1.9 EC @ 500 ml which is a new acaricide or fenpropathrin 30 EC 250-340 ml in 500 L water/ha.

fields.host_plant: Sorghum, maize, rice, wheat, sugarcane, bajra and ragi, barley, guinea grasses.
fields.host_plant_type: sugarcane, rabi and certain grasses.cereal crops
fields.lifecycle: A fully grown larva is formed in about 20- 40 days depending upon the climatic conditions
fields.bionomics: The adult moth is fawn-colored, with dark brown streaks on the fore wings and white hind wings
fields.growth_rate: About 4-5 generations are completed in a year.
fields.damage: The larva bores into the stem and damages the central shoot resulting in dead heart . In the vegetative phase, the central shoot dies off turning yellow in colour (dead heart). In the ear bearing stage, the ear head appears completely chaffy and white in colour (white ear head). Both come out easily when pulled up and show indication of feeding injuries at the base
fields.symptoms: Presence of brown coloured egg mass near the leaf tip. In vegetative stage larva enters the stem and feeds on the growing shoot and causes drying of the central shoot known as dead heart. In grown up plant whole ear heads become dried and yield chaffy grains called as white ear .Affected parts of stem may show internally tunneling caterpillars
fields.natural_enemies: Tetrastichus schoenobii Wasp Telomomous rowani Wasp Stenobracon nicevillei Braconidae Cotesia flavipes Braconidae Agriocnema pygmae - Damselfly
fields.colour: pale yellow with a purple pink tinge and a reddish-brown head
fields.species_example: yellow stemborer, white stemborer, striped stemborer, gold-fringed stemborer, dark-headed striped stemborer, and the pink stemborer
fields.favourable_condition: Mean temperature lower than 30 C and relative humidity exceeding 60% at Aduthurai were found to be favourable for higher stem borer infestation
fields.peak_occurance: plant dependent
fields.region: all over india
fields.reproduction: Eggs-about 300 eggs are laid, on leaves in clusters, incubation period-about 6 days. larval period : 3-4 weeks. Pupa : pupation in stem. Pupal period 7-10 days. Before pupation larva prepare a hole on stem at ground level for the moth to escape/come out. Adult : Adult longevity 2-4 days.
fields.preventive_measures: 1. Collection and destruction of stubbles after the harvest of crop to kill hibernating larvae. 2. Increase the seed rate to compensate the loss. 3. Follow proper crop rotation (with non host crop) 4. Use of light traps.
fields.insectiside: Spray any one of the following based on ETLs : Monocrotophos 36 SL 1000 ml/ha (or) Quinalphos 25 EC 1000 ml/ha (or) Phosphamidon 40 SL 600 ml/ha (or) Profenophos 50 EC 1000 ml/ha.
fields.ipm_techniques: Cultural Methods: Field should be necessarily be scouted during the vulnerable crop growth stages for early detection of dead hearts and white ear.Removal and proper disposal of stubbles will keep the borer population low in next crop.  Clip the tip of the seedlings before transplanting to eliminate egg masses. Collect and destroy the egg masses.Avoid close planting and continuous water stagnation at early stages.                      Biological Methods: Apply Bacillus thuringiensis var kurstaki at 2.5 kg/ha to reduce the oviposition by the stem borer. Release the egg cards in field during morning hours. Tie the egg cards under the leaf surface facing outside.

fields.host_plant: barley, sugarcane, pea, sorghum, pearl millet, maize, groundnut.
fields.lifecycle: Termite life cycles vary widely from species to species, from two years to 50.
fields.bionomics: The members of this group are social insects and are composed of workers, soldiers, king and queen. A) Reproductive caste : (Winged) : They live in royal chambers. Queen , King B) Sterile caste : (Wingless) : Soldiers , workers
fields.shape: Termites have large heads with no distinct body segmentation more ribbed texture
fields.damage: Termite damage starts soon after sowing and continues till the growing stage. The leaves of damaged plants droop down which later wither and dry. Such plants are easily uprooted.
fields.symptoms: Workers of termites feed on the roots and stem parts of the plants. This results in drying of the plants. Other forms do not cause any direct damage to the crop.
fields.natural_enemies: Arthropods such as ants, centipedes, cockroaches, crickets, dragonflies, scorpions and spiders, reptiles such as lizards, and amphibians such as frogs and toads consume termite
fields.size: one-eighth of an inch to one inch long
fields.colour: Colors range from white to light brown in color. Worker termites often appear lighter, while swarming termites are darker.
fields.species: 220 different species of termites in India
fields.species_example: Coptotermes gestroi. Coptotermes heimi. Heterotermes indicola. Schedorhinotermes spp.
fields.favourable_condition: moist, warm climate is ideal for termites, Wet or decayed wood, contact of wood with soil and pooled moisture around foundations are favorable conditions for termites
fields.reproduction: 7-10 days after aerial flight the female lays the first batch of eggs numbering 100-130. These eggs hatch in 40-42 days. The female termite then swells to become queen and lays upto 30,000 eggs per day.
fields.preventive_measures: Where the pest is of regular occurrence the soil should be mixed with endosulfan 4D or quinolphos 1.5 D or chlorpyriphos 5 D BHC or 10 D @ 35 kg/ha at the time of sowing , Locate and destroy the termite colony , Destroy the affected setts from the field
fields.insectiside: If the incidence of pest is noticed in standing crop dilute 2.5 L of endosulphan 35 EC or chlorpyriphos 20EC in 5 L of water and mix it with 50 kg of soil and broabcast even in 1 ha followed by light irrigation.
fields.ipm_techniques: Keep the crop healthy and vigorous. Shortage or water leading to initial drying of the plant, may lead to termite infestation. Hence, it is very necessary to keep the crop healthy and vigorous.
fields.speciality: Even though termites are not closely related to ants, they are sometimes referred to as white ants.

fields.host_plant: N/A
fields.lifecycle: Housefly: 28 days, Culex pipiens: 7 days
fields.bionomics: having only two wings as adults , The hind wings of flies are reduced to knob-like appendages called halteres (hall-TEERS) [7] that are used to balance them while flying
fields.growth_rate: Most Flies are univoltine (having only one generation per year), but under favourable conditions some may complete more generations in a year
fields.damage: Flies damage plants in many ways, mostly during the larval stage. Many feed directly on the plant, including the roots (e.g. Bibionidae and Anthomyiidae), stems, flowers or fruit (e.g. Tephritidae; left). Others mine the leaves, living and feeding in the tiny space between the upper and lower surfaces (e.g. Agromyzidae; right). Some lay eggs in plants and cause them to produce growths called galls - the larvae then live and feed inside these tumors
fields.symptoms: N/A
fields.colour: N/A
fields.species: more than 10000 species
fields.species_example: house flies, horse flies, blow flies, and mosquitoes
fields.favourable_condition: Flies are beneficial, too, functioning as scavengers, predators, or parasites of certain insect pests, as pollinators of plants
fields.peak_occurance: summer
fields.reproduction: The majority of flies lay eggs, which hatch into tiny larvae after a few hours or several days. The number of eggs laid by a female varies from 1 to about 250
fields.preventive_measures: N/A
fields.insectiside: N/A
fields.speciality: Flies are beneficial, too, functioning as scavengers, predators, or parasites of certain insect pests, as pollinators of plants

fields.host_plant: N/A
fields.lifecycle: The yellowjacket life cycle begins with a fertile queen, who builds a nest and uses stored sperm to create worker bees. These worker bees continue building the colony, and die off at the end of summer. The life cycle continues with newly-created queens hibernating through the winter to start the life cycle again the following spring.
fields.bionomics: a social winged insect which has a narrow waist and a sting and is typically yellow with black stripes. It constructs a paper nest from wood pulp and raises the larvae on a diet of insects.
fields.damage: Some wasp larvae cause damage by boring or mining into the stems or trunks of plants
fields.symptoms: N/A
fields.natural_enemies: bee-eaters
fields.size: 2-5 mm
fields.colour: yellow with black stripe
fields.species_example: pod wasp ,yellowjackets
fields.favourable_condition: N/A
fields.region: Andhra Pradesh, Orissa, Bihar, Maharastra and Karnataka.
fields.reproduction: Eggs are laid on flowers and very young pods. The white larva is apodous and 2-5 mm long when full-grown. Larval stage lasts for 8-10 days. Pupation is inside pod for 5-7 days.
fields.preventive_measures: you can try decreasing their numbers by fashioning a trap. Tie a slice of melon, fresh fish or meat to a stick and suspend it over a 5 gallon bucket, preferably a blue one. Partially fill the bucket with water and add a squirt of dish soap, then place the trap away from people
fields.insectiside: N/A
fields.speciality: Wasps are predators, which means they hunt live prey (like flies, caterpillars, and spiders) as a source of protein. In a world without wasps, we would need to use more toxic pesticides to control the insects that eat our crops and carry diseases.

fields.host_plant: Arabica coffee is the most preferred and principal host plant. Alternate host plants include Robusta tree coffee, teak, Oleadioica etc
fields.bionomics: Adult is a black, elongate beetle with grey pubescence on the head, thorax and elytra. Characteristic white markings are seen on the elytra.
fields.shape: elongated
fields.damage: Larvae enter into the hardwood and make the tunnels may extend even into the roots. Tunnels - tightly filed with the excreta of the grubs.Young plants (7 to 8 years old) attacked by the borer may die in a year
fields.symptoms: infested plants show visible ridges around the stem. Yellowing and wilting of leaves. older plants withstand the attack for a few seasons. However, such plants are less productive, yielding more of floats.
fields.natural_enemies: ladybird beetle , wolf spider
fields.size: 2.5 cm - adult
fields.colour: black,with grey pubescence on the head , Characteristic white markings are seen on the elytra.
fields.species_example: African white stemborer (Maliarpha separatella) Asiatic rice stemborer (striped rice stemborer, Chilo suppressalis) Banana stem borer (Telchin licus) Egyptian stemborer (Earias insulana)
fields.favourable_condition: warm temperatures are favourable for the successful completion of the pest life cycle
fields.region: White stem borer is the most serious pest of Arabica coffee in India. all ragi growing states of India
fields.reproduction: The female white stem borer lays the eggs near the tip of the leaf blade. The female lays eggs in batches of about 100 and are covered with silky greyish hairs; they resemble the eggs of the yellow stem borer. The incubation period is about 8 days. The larvae pupate in the stem.
fields.preventive_measures: Maintain optimum shade on the estates. Trace the infested plants - flight periods (i.e, during March and September) Every year - looking for ridges on the main stem and thick primaries. Collars prune the infested plants, uproot and burn the affected parts. Remove the loose scaly bark of the main stem and thick primaries using coir glove or coconut husk kill the eggs
fields.insectiside: Lindane 20 EC 1.25 lit + 200 ml Teepol in 500 L water at the time of peak adult activity (March and September). NSKE 5% also can be applied frequently.    Spray Beauveria bassiana available as a wettable powder formulation
fields.ipm_techniques: Spraying the main stem and thick primaries with neem kernel extract may afford good control of the pest. Field release of predators Apenesia sps for effective control of white stem borer
